title: England vs Belgium LIVE : Arnold Clark Cup latest goal updates after Chloe Kelly double for Lionesses
body_text:
England vs Belgium LIVE: Lionesses retain the Arnold Clark Cup with six-goal win
England have won the Arnold Clark Cup for the second time after thrashing Belgium 6-1 in Bristol, giving the Lionesses the perfect start to their World Cup year under Sarina Wiegman.
Two goals each from Chloe Kelly and captain Leah Williamson helped wrapped up a dominant result in front of over 26,000 fans at Ashton Gate. The victory added to wins against South Korea and Italy this week as the Lionesses took maximum points from the three-team tournament and comfortably retained their title.
Wiegmanâ€™s side won the inaugural edition of the Arnold Clark Cup last year ahead of their historic victory at the European Championships, and the Lionesses will hope the tournament once again acts as the perfect platform before this summerâ€™s World Cup in Australia and New Zealand.
England will face China, Denmark and Haiti in Group D of the World Cup, while the Lionesses will look to extend their unbeaten run under Wiegman - which now stands at 29 matches - when they take on Brazil and Australia in friendly matches in April.
Follow all the reaction as the Lionesses face Belgium for the Arnold Clark Cup:
England vs Belgium
England win the Arnold Clark Cup after defeating Belgium 6-1 in Bristol
90+2 GOAL! Williamson adds second to cap late flurry of goals (ENG 6-1 BEL)
90â€™ GOAL! Belgiumâ€™s Elena Dhont pulls one back with late screamer (ENG 5-1 BEL)
89â€™ GOAL! Bronze adds fifth from set piece as England cruise to title (ENG 5-0 BEL)
79â€™ GOAL! Stanway cross turned into her own net by Belgium defender Biesmans (ENG 4-0 BEL)
49â€™ GOAL! Kelly adds her second after Hemp makes immediate impact (ENG 3-0 BEL)
41â€™ GOAL! Williamson doubles Englandâ€™s lead with header from Bronze cross (ENG 2-0 BEL)
12â€™ GOAL! Kelly gives Lionesses perfect start after brilliant James dribble (ENG 1-0 BEL)
FULL TIME! England retain the Arnold Clark Cup!

GOAL! England 6-1 Belgium (WILLIAMSON 90+2â€™)

Williamson makes it six! What is going on?!
TWO FOR LEAH ğŸ¤Œ
Captain @leahcwilliamson latches onto the loose ball and cooly strokes it home ğŸ˜ pic.twitter.com/udrjEbxpd8â€” ITV Football (@itvfootball) February 22, 2023
GOAL! England 5-1 Belgium
21:33 , Jamie Braidwood
Wow - what a goal from Belgiumâ€™s Elena Dhont!
Stop scrolling and watch this absolute WORLDIE from Belgium's Elena Dhont ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡ªğŸš€ pic.twitter.com/ckn5M1SupI

GOAL! England 5-0 Belgium (BRONZE 89â€™)
21:31 , Jamie Braidwood
Thereâ€™s a fifth! Five stars for England as Bronze taps in another for the Lionesses from a set piece.
A goal for an England centurion ğŸ’¯@LucyBronze turns the ball home from 8 yards after Rachel Daly touched on the cross from Chloe Kelly ğŸ‘ pic.twitter.com/UsjR2HD5qJ
â€” ITV Football (@itvfootball) February 22, 2023
England 4-0 Belgium
21:29 , Jamie Braidwood
85 mins; The changes have taken some of the pace out of the game, while Belgium are also well beaten by this point. Chloe Kelly, deservedly, is named player of the match. She may have scored two tap-ins but her all-round attacking play has been outstanding.
England 4-0 Belgium
21:24 , Jamie Braidwood
81 mins: Park is on for Toone, while the crowd cheer a rare touch for Mary Earps.
GOAL! England 4-0 Belgium (Biesmans OG 79â€™)
21:21 , Jamie Braidwood
England have a fourth! Stanway makes a brilliant run off the shoulder and Kelly picks out her run. Stanway pulls it back and her cross is turned into her own net by Biesmans for an own goal.
England 3-0 Belgium
21:18 , Jamie Braidwood
77 mins: The attendance at Ashton Gate tonight is confirmed as 26,169.
England 3-0 Belgium
21:17 , Jamie Braidwood
75 mins: Sarina Wiegman could have her feet up on the bench by this point. So too could Mary Earps in the England goal.
England 3-0 Belgium
21:14 , Jamie Braidwood
71 mins: Further changes for England: as Rachel Daly replaces Alessia Russo. A clear sign, then, that itâ€™s Russo and Daly who are likely to compete for the starting spot at the World Cup. Daly is also going for the golden boot, and is only a goal behind Kelly.
England 3-0 Belgium
21:12 , Jamie Braidwood
68 mins: Hemp has slotted into Englandâ€™s attack superbly and goes close after cutting inside from the right wing. Stanway then reads the play well and steps in to make the interception. Her shot is deflected narrowly wide.
England 3-0 Belgium
21:08 , Jamie Braidwood
65 mins: OFF THE BAR! What a save this is from Evrard, the Belgium goalkeeper. She gets a fingertip save on a swirling drive from Toone, hit from almost the same spot as Kelly earlier.
England 3-0 Belgium
21:05 , Jamie Braidwood
62 mins: A second change for England as Alex Greenwood is replaced by Jess Carter at left back.
England 3-0 Belgium
21:02 , Jamie Braidwood
60 mins: OFF THE BAR! So close again from Kelly! This time she ducks right and takes aim across goal. The shot is vicious and glances the top of the bar. What a way to score a hat-trick that would have been.
England 3-0 Belgium
21:01 , Jamie Braidwood
56 mins: The chances keep coming for the Lionesses - Bronze sees space for a forward run and picks out an excellent cross towards Russo, who is unlucky that her flicked header drifts wide.
GOAL! England 3-0 Belgium
20:56 , Jamie Braidwood
53 mins: Thatâ€™s so good from Kelly. A brilliant run into the box, ducking and diving between challenges, creates space for the shot, which is lifted over the bar from the angle.
GOAL! England 3-0 Belgium (KELLY 49â€™)
20:52 , Jamie Braidwood
Itâ€™s two for Chloe Kelly! But itâ€™s brilliant from Lauren Hemp, who picks it up on the left and glides inside. She sets up Russo, who shoots. The goalkeeper spills but Kelly is there to poke in Englandâ€™s third.
Kelly is now leading the way for the golden boot!
Right place. Right time.
âš½ï¸ @Chloe_Kelly98 pic.twitter.com/t32Ng4UL4Uâ€” Lionesses (@Lionesses) February 22, 2023
England 2-0 Belgium
20:51 , Jamie Braidwood
48 mins: England have picked up where they left off before the break. Toone threatens with a dipping shot from distance before England play in Hemp down the side.
England 2-0 Belgium
20:47 , Jamie Braidwood
Back underway! Lauren Hemp is on for Lauren James at the break.
Hemp was Englandâ€™s player of the tournament in last yearâ€™s Arnold Clark Cup, which just underlines the strength in depth that Wiegman now has in her squad.
HALF TIME! England 2-0 Belgium
20:45 , Jamie Braidwood
Wiegman is set to make some changes at the break, as the England manager looks to shuffle her squad and perhaps reward some of those players who featured against Italy on Sunday.
HALF TIME! England 2-0 Belgium
20:35 , Jamie Braidwood
England have had 71 per cent of the possession and 14 shots so far. At times, itâ€™s felt like wave after wave of England attack, which is so dangerous given the attacking talent Wiegman has at her disposal.
HALF TIME! England 2-0 Belgium
20:32 , Jamie Braidwood
And thatâ€™s half time! England are in control after a dominant first-half display.
GOAL! England 2-0 Belgium (WILLIAMSON 41â€™)
20:28 , Jamie Braidwood
The captain doubles Englandâ€™s lead! Thereâ€™s a touch of controversy around the goal as the ball seemed to brush off Russoâ€™s arm in the build up, but no matter. From the corner, England kept the attack going and it broke to Bronze on the left. The full-back picked out a lovely cross to the back post, where Williamson climbed to power the header into the net.
The cross from Bronze was sublime.

England's skipper arrives at the back post to put her side 2-0 up ğŸ’ª#ENGBEL | @ITV 4 pic.twitter.com/M9P4Dn3xQxâ€” ITV Football (@itvfootball) February 22, 2023
England 1-0 Belgium
20:26 , Jamie Braidwood
39 mins: Close! James threatens again - Bronze creates space with the overlapping run as James cuts inside onto her left foot. It sits up a bit, as Jamesâ€™ shot rises over the bar.
James then slips in Stanway, whose touch takes her towards the byline where she wins the corner.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:25 , Jamie Braidwood
38 mins: Not this time though from James, who burned the Belgium full-back Cayman with a step-over but then overhit her cross towards the back post. The acceleration from James after the drop of the shoulder is just special, though.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:23 , Jamie Braidwood
36 mins: Good defending from Biesmans, who beats Russo to Jamesâ€™ cross. The delivery from James was brilliant again, hit first time and with no hesitation from the right wing.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:22 , Jamie Braidwood
34 mins: England are so clearly on top that the Lionesses just need to make sure they donâ€™t get sloppy in the final third. There have been a few examples of players straying offside or not picking the right pass when it mattered.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:20 , Jamie Braidwood
32 mins: Brilliant from Kelly, who turns in the box and then wriggles away from a challenge to get to the byline. It takes a risky challenge from Biesmans to slide in and stop her run. The defender was able to get just enough of the ball.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:18 , Jamie Braidwood
29 mins: The Belgium midfielder Missipo reacts to a challenge from Stanway from behind, which the referee has to intervene on.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:15 , Jamie Braidwood
28 mins: England are able to find James out wide, and the cross towards Russo is dangerous too. The flag is up for offside though.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:13 , Jamie Braidwood
26 mins: Toone with a lovely backheel flick towards Kelly, who cuts inside but sees her shot blocked and out for a corner. From the delivery, Bright has a chance after rising in the box, but itâ€™s headed over.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:12 , Jamie Braidwood
24 mins: England are moving the ball really well into the final third - with James and then Williamson threading passes through the lines. Bronze and Toone are guilty of a couple of loose touches when the ball does get there, but England quickly win it back and go again.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:10 , Jamie Braidwood
23 mins: Keira Walsh missed the win over South Korea due to illness but has just elevated their control as the Barcelona midfielder returns to Wiegmanâ€™s strongest line-up.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:08 , Jamie Braidwood
20 mins: England are getting so much possession on the edge of the Belgium box. Now Toone tries a flick towards Kelly, when she had the chance to shoot. Belgium are barely getting out of their half.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:05 , Jamie Braidwood
18 mins: England are enjoying this. Toone does a step-over on the edge before Stanway drops a shoulder and shoots. It takes a deflection and loops up to James - but the volley is straight at the goalkeeper.
England 1-0 Belgium
20:03 , Jamie Braidwood
16 mins: James creates more danger for England from the right side, her cross just a bit above Kelly at the back post. Greenwood picks it up on the other side and whips a ball towards the box, but Russo is just eased away from it by the Belgium defender.
GOAL! England 1-0 Belgium (Kelly, 12 min)
19:59 , Jamie Braidwood
Chloe Kelly scores after great work by Lauren James down the right, who dribbles into the box and crosses low for her winger on the opposite side. The ball pops up off a Belgian defender and Kelly taps home. A well-deserved opener for England.
You just cannot stop Lauren James ğŸ’¨
She's in the thick of it to assist Chloe Kelly and put England 1-0 up ğŸ‘
Watch England v Belgium live now on ITV4 pic.twitter.com/EyWt84xYmkâ€” ITV Football (@itvfootball) February 22, 2023
England 0-0 Belgium
19:56 , Lawrence Ostlere
9 min: This is an extremely one-sided affair, thus far. Alex Greenwood gives away a free-kick and it gives the visitors a rare breather.
England 0-0 Belgium
19:55 , Lawrence Ostlere
7 min: England should be in front already! Keira Walsh plays a typically piercing pass through the Belgian defence for Chloe Kelly, who whips a delivery across the six-yard box for the arriving for Lauren James. The whole stadium expects the net to bulge but somehow James fires over the bar.
England 0-0 Belgium
19:52 , Lawrence Ostlere
5 min: A couple of half-sighters for Alessia Russo, first with a long-range shot which was blocked, and then a moment later with a header which she tried to flick on target but couldnâ€™t quite connect properly.
England 0-0 Belgium
19:50 , Lawrence Ostlere
2 min: A really bright and energetic start from England. Chloe Kelly gets in behind down the left side of the box and drills in a low cut-back, which has to be cleared behind for a corner.
Kick-off! England 0-0 Belgium
19:47 , Lawrence Ostlere
Weâ€™re under way... although Georgia Stanway forgot about taking the knee and had to retake the kick-off.
Sarina Weigmann speaks to ITV
19:38 , Lawrence Ostlere
More from the England manager before kick-off:
â€œYou can tell Lauren James is in good form and enjoying herself. She is a very talented player and has been for years. Now she is fit she gets some consistency at Chelsea and that does her good and does us good as well.
â€œOf course we want to retain this cup and that is how we approach this and every game, to win it. Of course when there is a cup to win we want to win it.â€
Sarina Weigmann speaks to ITV
19:35 , Lawrence Ostlere
â€œI think Rachel Daly and Alessia Russo are both very good so they are competing for the position. Of course we all know Alessia is an incredibly talented player so we wanted to see that today. The competition in the team is very high and that is good for us.
â€œWe donâ€™t have to know our best XI yet. We want to try out a couple of things this week, see lots of players and see their connection and manage loads. Of course we are going to play to win this game but we donâ€™t have to decide the starting line-up for July yet.â€
England line-up
19:29 , Lawrence Ostlere
A reminder that England just need to avoid defeat tonight to retain their title. Hereâ€™s that XI again:
Earps; Bronze, Bright, Williamson, Greenwood; Stanway, Walsh; James, Toone, Kelly; Russo.
England team news
19:24 , Lawrence Ostlere
England boss Sarina Wiegman has made nine changes to her starting line-up for their final Arnold Clark Cup match against Belgium at Ashton Gate.
Keira Walsh and Alex Greenwood are the only survivors from the team that started Sundayâ€™s 2-1 win over Italy as Wiegman, whose side need to avoid defeat to retain the trophy, named almost the same XI as she had for the 4-0 win against South Korea last Thursday.
Skipper Leah Williamson is among those returning and the attack was back to featuring a front three of Alessia Russo, Chloe Kelly and Lauren James.
Sarina Wiegman says lack of diversity within Lionesses squad â€˜wonâ€™t change overnightâ€™
19:18 , Lawrence Ostlere
Hereâ€™s more from Sarina Wiegman on the issue:
Millie Bright positive about â€œmore diverse futureâ€ for English womenâ€™s football
19:06 , Lawrence Ostlere
Defender Millie Bright, whose manager at Chelsea Emma Hayes last week described womenâ€™s football as â€œquite middle classâ€ as she expressed concerns about opportunities for girls, said: â€œI think we have addressed it and changes are in place. But, again, itâ€™s not something thatâ€™s going to happen overnight.
â€œI donâ€™t really think you can put a timeframe on it, but I think itâ€™s nice knowing changes have been made and that things are in place to allow it to be more diverse in the future.â€
Sarina Wiegman says lack of diversity within Lionesses squad â€˜wonâ€™t change overnightâ€™
18:58 , Lawrence Ostlere
More from Tuesday's pre-match press conference, which saw Wiegman asked about diversity, with regard to the current England set-up, a talking point last summer when the Lionesses' starting XI at the Euros featured no players from black, Asian or mixed heritage backgrounds.
Earlier this month the Football Association announced a new-look women's and girls' player pathway that it said was to "unearth the very best talent in England, while also making the game more diverse, accessible and inclusive", with up to 70 Emerging Talent Centres being established across the country, catering for players aged eight to 16.
Wiegman was asked about that - as well as the lack of diversity in the England Under-23s team for Monday's 4-1 win against Belgium - and how long she thought it would be before true representation was seen in the squads.
And she said: "You're not going to change it overnight. Over the last weeks the FA, we launched I think an improved pathway which really is about of course performance, but also inclusivity, diversity and accessibility.
"And hopefully in the future, and I don't know how long that will take, we get of course very, very good players, but it represents more the diversity of our community."
England vs Belgium: Team news!
18:44 , Jamie Braidwood
That is strong from Sarina Wiegman: itâ€™s the same team that started against South Korea, but with Keira Walsh - who missed that game due to illness - starting in midfield and Leah Williamson moving back to defence.
The first-choice XI ahead of the World Cup?
England vs Belgium: Team news!
18:43 , Jamie Braidwood
England: Earps; Bronze, Bright, Williamson, Greenwood; Stanway, Walsh; James, Toone, Kelly; Russo
Câ€™MON! ğŸ¤©
What do you think of the #Lionesses starting tonight? pic.twitter.com/7fo71XTZDNâ€” Lionesses (@Lionesses) February 22, 2023
England vs Belgium
18:40 , Jamie Braidwood
Team news is expected shortly: will Wiegman rotate back to the team that thrashed South Korea or have any of the Lionesses fringe players done enough to earn a starting spot tonight?
England vs Belgium
18:36 , Jamie Braidwood
The England team arriving at Ashton Gate - which is sold out tonight.
England vs Belgium
18:34 , Jamie Braidwood
Rachel Daly remained resolute she would â€œplay anywhereâ€ for England after another impressive audition for the permanent number nine role in the Lionessesâ€™ 2-1 victory over Italy in the Arnold Clark Cup.
England extended their unbeaten streak to 28 games after Daly scored headers in either half to make it two wins from two for the hosts, who beat South Korea 4-0 in their tournament opener.
Daly plays up front for Aston Villa and is the Womenâ€™s Super Leagueâ€™s joint leading goal-scorer alongside Manchester Cityâ€™s Bunny Shaw, netting 10 so far this season, but was employed at left-back throughout the Lionessesâ€™ Euro 2022-winning campaign.
â€œI will always say I will play anywhere,â€ Daly told ITV. â€œI am happy to score but winning the game was in the forefront of my mind and that is what we needed to do and that is what we did and delivered and the team played brilliantly today.
â€œI think I am pretty good in the air. It probably helps when I am playing all over the place in different positions. For me, right place right time, fantastic ball from Lauren James for the second one and Robbo (Katie Robinson) the first one. I am here to score goals when I play up front, we got the win and that is the most important thing.
â€œThat is what comes with the depth that we have in this squad. We have some unbelievable players in this team and every single one of them is capable of playing at any time and you saw that tonight.
â€œThere were some amazing performances, there is plenty more to come. It keeps us on our toes. but the competition is so healthy and one that we all thrive in and want that challenge.â€
England vs Belgium
18:21 , Jamie Braidwood
Sarina Wiegman says she does not know what her best XI is as the Lionesses manager prepares to make further changes tonight against Belgium.
Wiegman has rotated her team throughout the Arnold Clark Cup so far and said ahead of tonightâ€™s match: â€œIt shows the team is really good and itâ€™s hard to make decisions.
â€œWe donâ€™t really know the strongest XI at the moment but we donâ€™t need to know yet.
â€œI think the depth in the squad is growing. What you see now is that itâ€™s really hard to make decisions. We have such a big group that are able to play on that stage.
â€œWe have more than 11 players who could start in the team. Itâ€™s not that theyâ€™re not good enough to start, itâ€™s just technical choices we make.
â€œWe donâ€™t have to make that decision now. But itâ€™s actually really exciting.â€
England vs Belgium: Early team news
18:17 , Jamie Braidwood
Kiera Walshâ€™s return to Englandâ€™s line-up against Italy means that neither side have any injury concerns heading into Wednesdayâ€™s encounter.
Both sides have rotated heavily throughout the tournament but may well opt to put forward their strongest sides for this tournament-deciding encounter.
Predicted line-ups
England: Earps; Bronze, Bright, Williamson, Greenwood; Stanway, Walsh; James, Toone, Kelly; Russo
Belgium: Evrard; Cayman, Kees, De Neve, Meersman; De Caigny, Detruyer, Vanhaevermaet, Biesmans, Dhont; Wullaert
When is England vs Belgium?
18:16 , Jamie Braidwood
The match will kick off at 7:45pm GMT on Wednesday 22 February at Ashton Gate
How can I watch it?
It will be shown live on ITV 4, with coverage starting at 7pm. It will also be available to watch online on the ITV X platform.
Good evening
18:15 , Jamie Braidwood
Hello and welcome to live build-up to England vs Belgium - the final and deciding match of the Arnold Clark Cup. England are one step away from retaining the Arnold Clark Cup and take on Belgium in a winner-takes-all match that will determine which nation lifts the trophy. The Lionesses avoided a scare in their last match against Italy but a brace from Rachel Daly saw them claim a 2-1 victory and extend their unbeaten run under Sarina Wiegman to 28 matches.
Belgium have also won their opening two matches â€“ both 2-1 against Italy and South Korea â€“ and will want to cause an upset against the European Champions. The question now is whether Wiegman will revert to an almost full-strength line-up or continue to rotate and let her squad players compete in tonightâ€™s crucial outing.
Follow all the action as the Lionesses face Belgium for the Arnold Clark Cup
